author: James Martin
method: Preheat the oven to 210C/410/Gas 7. For the choucroute, heat a large saucepan over a gentle heat and add the olive oil, cabbage, garlic and bay leaf. Stir for 1-2 minutes to combine then add the vegetable stock. Bring the stock to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer. Cover with a lid and cook for 40 minutes. Remove the lid, add the sultanas and continue to cook until all of the liquid has evaporated. For the salmon, place the hot-smoked salmon onto a baking tray and place into the oven to cook for 5-10 minutes, or until heated through. To serve, slice the hot-smoked salmon and place onto plates. Place a generous spoonful of choucroute alongside.
ingredients: 110ml/4fl oz extra virgin olive oil,  1 white cabbage, finely shredded,  2 garlic cloves, crushed,  1 bay leaf,  200ml/7fl oz vegetable stock,  2 tbsp sultanas,  600g/1lb 5oz hot-smoked salmon
